pageContext.claim: “I ordered sweeping travel restrictions, increased travel advisory levels, established screening measures, and imposed historic quarantines.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's action included 11 exemptions and allowed flights to to keep going. The New York Times estimated nearly 40,000 people traveled from China to the United States in the two months after Trump imposed restrictions on such travel -- and at least 430,000 people have arrived in the United States on direct flights from China before the restrictions. While Trump often suggests the United States imposed the first ban, dozens of countries acted before the United States.
